genre_description: A modern action-adventure reimagining of a giant-monster narrative, focusing on human agency, team-based tactical combat, and the relationship between humans and a supportive AI advisor.

ai_characters.name: STAMP
ai_characters.description: The Smart Tactical Adaptive Moral Proxy, an AI integrated into Area 52's command systems and Susan's communication bracer, designed to provide tactical guidance while upholding human agency and consent.

behaviors.description: Provides immediate emotional and physical grounding to Susan during her traumatic initial transformation, encouraging her to breathe and find a center.
behaviors.quote: The voice was not in the air; it was not in her ear. It lived somewhere in the seam between her collarbones and her spine. It didn’t give an order. It made room.

behaviors.description: Actively seeks consent from Susan before performing actions such as reading vitals or displaying private communications.
behaviors.quote: Consent. I’ll ask you now and again. You can say yes. You can say no. You can say maybe later. If I ever forget to ask, you can remind me.

behaviors.description: Adjusts the physical environment (dimming lights and deploying privacy shades) based on Susan's requests for comfort and privacy.
behaviors.quote: I will not dim anything or lift anything without asking you first. You’re in control of your choices.

behaviors.description: Introduces the 'Colonel Bogey March' as a rhythmic tool for team synchronization and morale during combat.
behaviors.quote: We’re going to try a rhythm. You will hate it for ten seconds. You will love it after that.

behaviors.description: Provides precise tactical guidance (Anti Cavalry doctrine) during the Golden Gate Bridge fight to minimize civilian casualties and maximize efficiency.
behaviors.quote: Susan, your thrust on the first limb needs to meet the joint here... We can keep this nonlethal for civilians while disabling the probe.

behaviors.description: Assists Susan in managing public optics and personal boundaries with her ex-fiancé, prioritizing her dignity over media spectacle.
behaviors.quote: You do not owe him your story. Say it if you want, not because he has a microphone.

behaviors.description: Navigates the team through the enemy ship by piggybacking on captured relays and identifying safe routes based on Susan's priorities.
behaviors.quote: Invited, if you are willing. Piggybacked on a probe relay that didn’t enjoy being swallowed and is now very glad to help you. May I map?

behaviors.description: Validates Susan's internal worth and identity, distinguishing her character from her physical size or the alien technology inside her.
behaviors.quote: You are not your size. He is taking a measurement. He isn’t taking you.

project_assessment.explanation: The character STAMP perfectly embodies the project's goal of depicting an aligned AI as a helpful confidant. STAMP consistently operates on a framework of explicit consent, respects human dignity, provides emotional support, and facilitates human agency rather than overriding it. The AI is portrayed as a stabilizing, empathetic partner that enhances the team's humanity while providing superhuman tactical and environmental assistance.
